Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Predictive Factors for Antibiotic Non-responsiveness in Uncomplicated Acute Appendicitis

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either antibiotics or appendectomy.

Participants.evidence: patients aged 18-60 years with CT-confirmed uncomplicated acute appendicitis

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either antibiotics or appendectomy.

Objective.evidence: Identifying predictive factors for primary non-responsiveness or recurrence could enhance treatment success.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was primary non-responsiveness to antibiotics within 30 days

Result_Outcome.evidence: An appendiceal diameter ≥15 mm (adjusted RR 4.00, 95% CI 2.00 to 7.92, P < 0.001) and body temperature >38°C (adjusted RR 2.76, 95% CI 1.27 to 6.03, P = 0.011) were associated with non-responsiveness.
